At first I thought it was like ABS. Now I'm not so sure.

What is Friction Control, along with the auto override functions, how do they actually work?

1 minute ago, g00bd0g said:

At first I thought it was like ABS. Now I'm not so sure.

What is Friction Control, along with the auto override functions, how do they actually work?

 

To the best of my knowledge, it's basically just the grip factor.  Turn it up, and it's like really soft rubber on gritty pavement... turn it down, and it's like oiled steel sliding along ice.. in theory.  Not sure what auto does.

27 minutes ago, Renegrade said:

To the best of my knowledge, it's basically just the grip factor.  Turn it up, and it's like really soft rubber on gritty pavement... turn it down, and it's like oiled steel sliding along ice.. in theory.  Not sure what auto does.

So not just ABS, but global grip? Including laterally? That makes the "auto" function even more interesting...

Edited April 29, 2016 by g00bd0g

Auto mode is kind of voodoo. I don't know if anyone outside of Squad knows how it works. 

Override gives you a slider that's a multiplier to config settings.

Friction increases wheel grip, laterally you're less prone to fish-tailing, but more likely to flip if you take sharp turns; forward/backwards you can go up steeper inclines.

Traction multiplier adjusts wheel motor power. higher means you can go up steeper inclines.
